meanings.definition: The act of protruding or the state of being protruded.
meanings.sent1: The protrusion of the tree roots above the ground was fascinating to the children.
meanings.sent2: I noticed a small protrusion on the wall where the paint had chipped off.
meanings.sent3: The protrusion of the cake frosting made it look like a mountain range.
meanings.sent4: Her protrusion into the conversation brought a new perspective to the topic.
meanings.sent5: The protrusion of the rock formation against the sunset was a breathtaking sight.

meanings.sent1: The strange protrusion on the tree trunk caught my attention.
meanings.sent2: I accidentally bumped into a protrusion on the table and hurt my knee.
meanings.sent3: The protrusion on the balloon made it look like a funny animal.
meanings.sent4: His protrusion of excitement was evident in his wide smile.
meanings.sent5: The protrusion of the ship's bow sliced through the water effortlessly.

meanings.definition: A bulging out or projecting part.
meanings.sent1: The protrusion of the hill in the distance was a welcome sight after a long hike.
meanings.sent2: The protrusion of the button on his shirt made it difficult to put on the jacket.
meanings.sent3: The protrusion of the cloud over the horizon looked like a giant cotton candy.
meanings.sent4: Her protrusion of kindness towards others made her a beloved member of the community.
meanings.sent5: The protrusion of the building's architecture was a blend of modern and traditional styles.
